meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! I'm back with another groovy review for you all! Today, I'm tackling Lords of the Fallen, a soulslike game that's got everyone talking. Let me put on my critic hat and give you the lowdown.

First off, kudos to IGN for calling out those pesky technical issues. I mean, who hasn't been there - trying to enjoy a game only to have it crash or stutter every five minutes? Not exactly the most fun experience, right? But hey, at least they acknowledged it and didn't just gloss over it.

Now, onto the good stuff! Slant Magazine got it spot on when they said Lords of the Fallen brings darkness to the light. I mean, this game is all about exploring a mysterious world filled with ancient ruins, hidden temples, and creepy crawlies. It's like being trapped in a gothic dream (but don't worry, you can wake up whenever you want).

Gaming Age had some wise words too - they said the game isn't bad, just needs some fine-tuning. I'm all for games that are receptive to feedback, especially when it comes to addressing issues like enemy density or health bars. It's all about creating a smooth experience, folks!

Worth Playing got it right when they said Lords of the Fallen innovates and looks good while doing so. I mean, who doesn't love a game that adds new mechanics and gameplay twists? It's like getting a fresh pair of kicks (or in this case, a new way to kick some butt).

SpazioGames, on the other hand... well, let's just say they were a bit harsh. Lords of the Fallen isn't perfect, but come on - every game has its flaws! And hey, at least it's not boring.

GamingTrend and God is a Geek had similar takes - entertaining gameplay with some great action RPG elements, but also some issues to iron out. I mean, what's wrong with having high standards? You want the best, right?

There you have it, folks! That's my take on Lords of the Fallen. It's not perfect, but it's definitely worth playing if you're into soulslike games or just looking for something new and exciting. And remember, even the most seasoned critics (heh, like me) can't resist a good pun or two...
